text:
Jacques Monory (25 June 1924 – 17 October 2018) was a French painter and filmmaker. Monory was first exhibited at the Drouant-David Gallery in Paris in 1952. During the 1960s, he became one of the leading figures of the European movement of [http://www.tate.org.uk/art/art-terms/p/pop-art Pop Art].
In 1968, he directed the influential movie [https://vimeo.com/93062578 Ex-] and painted the series [https://www.jacquesmonory.com/?portfolio=meurtres Les Meurtres (Murders)].
Monory died on 17 October 2018 in Paris from pneumonia at the age of 94.
